title: Vocabulary & Word Usage - EASY Level
description: üó£Ô∏è Build your foundational word bank! This quiz covers common $\text{synonyms \, and \, antonyms}$ üîÑ, basic $\text{homophones}$ üëÇ, and everyday words often $\text{misused \, in \, simple \, sentences}$. (20 Questions - 30 Minutes)

questions.text: Choose the correct word to complete the sentence: 'I want to go $\mathbf{...}$ the movies with you.'
What is a **synonym** for the word $\mathbf{HAPPY}$?
Which word is the correct $\mathbf{homophone}$ in the sentence: 'The horse ate some $\mathbf{...}$.'
What is an **antonym** for the word $\mathbf{BIG}$?
Choose the word that means 'a person who travels to a sacred place for religious reasons.'
Fill in the blank: 'We watched the play $\mathbf{...}$ a long time.'
A $\mathbf{Synonym}$ is a word that has the same or nearly the same meaning as another word. (True/False)
Which word means 'to begin or start'?
Which word means the **opposite** of $\mathbf{NEAT}$?
The correct form of the plural noun $\mathbf{mouse}$ is:
Choose the correct word: '$\mathbf{...}$ book is this?'
A word used to describe a sharp, strong, and sudden taste or smell is:
What is the $\mathbf{root \, word}$ of 'unbelievable'?
Which word should be used when comparing $\mathbf{two}$ items?
Choose the word that means 'to stop working or functioning suddenly and completely.'
The word $\mathbf{Affect}$ is generally used as a $\mathbf{...}$?
What is the $\mathbf{antonym}$ for $\mathbf{WET}$?
Which word is a $\mathbf{homophone}$ of 'write'?
The prefix $\mathbf{un-}$ typically means...
Complete the sentence: 'The team worked $\mathbf{...}$ to finish the project.'
